    • Work Permit Rejection Reasons and Rejection Cancellation

      16 August 2024
      • What is a Work Permit? What kind of advantages does it give? Click to Find Out

      What is a Work Permit? What kind of advantages does it give?

      Click here and contact us to get a Work Permit

      What is it?

      A work permit is a document issued by the Ministry of Labor and Social Security on behalf of the relevant citizen, enabling them to work in Turkey.

      The Benefits

      The work permit also counts as a residence permit, so if you get a work permit, you do not need a residence permit.
      Your family can benefit from some of the rights provided by the work permit, these are:
      - Your spouse and your child under the age of 18 can obtain a family residence permit
      - Your spouse and your child under the age of 18 can receive free treatment in all public hospitals in Turkey
      and many more.
      When you have a continuous 5-year work permit in Turkey, you are entitled to become a Turkish citizen. You can retire in Turkey. After you retire, you gain the right to benefit from all retirement benefits.

      My work permit is about to end, what should i do?

      In case your work permit expires, you will have to get a residence permit or extend your work permit, since your residence permit rights provided by the work permit will also expire.

      When can i extend my Work Permits validity?

      You can make an application starting from the last 60 days before your Work Permit ends.
      Click Here and Contact Us to Get Help With Your Procedures

      Who Can Get A Work Permit From Turkey?

      A work permit can be issued to foreigners who have had a residence permit in Turkey for at least 6 months, except undergraduate students whom don't need to meet the 6 month requirement to get a work permit.

      Which Countries Citizens are Given a Work Permit the Most?

      Countries whose citizens are granted the most work permits:
      Syria
      Russia
      Turkmenistan
      Uzbekistan
      Iran
      Afghanistan
      Azerbaijan

      What are the Requirements for a Work Permit?

      The paid fund of the workplace where a work permit application is made must be at least 100,000 TL. In addition, the gross sales amount of this business must be 800,000 TL or the company's export amount of the previous year must be 250,000 USD.

      At least five of the employees in the workplace where the foreign worker wants to work must be Turkish citizens. If the foreign worker is a partner of the company, at least 5 workers who are Turkish citizens are required to work in the workplace during the last 6 months of the work permit period. In general, there should be 1 foreign employee for every 5 Turkish citizen employees.

      The first two conditions are not required for applications for domestic work (patient, elderly, or child care).
